name: Diazepam (Valium)
summary: A long-acting benzodiazepine used for anxiety disorders, muscle spasms, seizures, and alcohol withdrawal.
description: Diazepam is a long-acting benzodiazepine with anxiolytic, muscle relaxant, anticonvulsant, and sedative properties. It enhances the effect of the inhibitory neurotransmitter GABA at the GABA-A receptor. Diazepam is indicated for anxiety disorders, acute alcohol withdrawal, muscle spasticity, seizure disorders, and as premedication for procedures.

sections.text: Binds to the benzodiazepine site on the GABA-A receptor, enhancing GABA's inhibitory effect by increasing chloride channel opening frequency, leading to CNS depression.

adult.alcohol-withdrawal: 10 mg orally every 6–8 hours initially, tapering to 5 mg as needed
adult.status-epilepticus: 5–10 mg IV every 10–15 minutes as needed (max 30 mg in 8 hours)

sections.geriatric: Start at lower doses (e.g., 2 mg 1–2 times daily)
sections.hepatic_impairment: Avoid in severe impairment; lower doses in mild/moderate
sections.renal_impairment: Use with caution; no formal dose adjustment

sections.text: Onset: 15–60 minutes orally, 1–5 minutes IV; Duration: 12–24 hours

sections.black_box: Concomitant use with opioids may result in profound sedation, respiratory depression, coma, and death.
other: Risk of dependence and withdrawal; limit duration of use

items: Symptom control for anxiety or withdrawal

sections.pregnancy: Category D; risk of fetal harm and neonatal withdrawal
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or monitor infant closely

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended to prevent withdrawal symptoms such as anxiety, insomnia, and seizures.

items: Long half-life may lead to accumulation, especially in elderly
Not recommended for long-term management of anxiety due to dependence risk
